title: Japan: Taiwan vessel entered Japanese exclusive economic zone
description: A Japanese Coast Guard patrol plane spotted a Taiwanese research vessel within its exclusive economic zone near Okinawa on Sunday afternoon, Taiwan’s Central News Agency reported, quoting The Daily Yomiuri.
cleanContent:
Ocean Researcher No.2 of the National Taiwan Ocean University (file photo)

By Mei Jingya, Sina EnglishA Japanese Coast Guard patrol plane spotted a Taiwanese research vessel within its exclusive economic zone near Okinawa on Sunday afternoon, Taiwan’s Central News Agency reported, quoting The Daily Yomiuri.Ocean Researcher No.2, which belongs to the National Taiwan Ocean University, was sighted 94 kilometers southwest of Hateruma-jima, Okinawa and sailed in Japan’s exclusive economic zone (EEC), Japan claimed.According to the report, Japan’s Coast Guard personnel communicated with crew aboard the Taiwan ship via radio, asking about the purpose of the expedition. The answer was “water quality survey”.Japan then asked the research vessel to leave its EEC. But the Taiwanese ship did not heed the warning.Related news: | |
